snippet: Iraq’s prime minister ordered the air force to support Kurdish forces fighting ISIS, a thaw born of military necessity in the fraught relations between Baghdad and the Kurds.
abstract: Iraqi Prime Min Nuri Kamal al-Maliki orders nation's air force to support Kurdish forces fighting Sunni extremists in north; move represents cooling of tense relations between central government and Kurdish leaders in region.
lead_paragraph: Iraq’s prime minister ordered the air force to support Kurdish forces fighting ISIS, a thaw born of military necessity in the fraught relations between Baghdad and the Kurds.

headline.main: Iraq Agrees to Help Kurds Battle Sunni Extremists
headline.print_headline: Iraq Agrees to Help Kurds Battle Sunni Extremists

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
